newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PLDT says U.S. acts on callback complaint.
newsitem.headline: PLDT says U.S. acts on callback complaint.

text.p: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has ordered a US-based firm to stop offering callback services to the Philippines after a complaint by the Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co (PLDT).
PLDT said on Wednesday it was entitled to damages from International Telecom Ltd, based on the FCC order.

Callback services, mainly based in the United States, offer, for a small fee, to call back overseas customers and provide them with a U.S. dial tone, allowing them to pay cheaper U.S. charges for international calls.
The FCC has declared it a violation of U.S. law for American firms to offer callback services to countries that ban the service.
